item.title: Putin Led a Complex Cyberattack Scheme to Aid Trump, Report Finds
item.media:description: President-elect Donald J. Trump left One World Trade Center after a meeting on Friday.
item.description: U.S. intelligence agencies presented their unanimous conclusions to Donald J. Trump, bringing the leaders of these agencies face to face with their most vocal skeptic, the president-elect.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and DAVID E. SANGER

item.title: Trump Finds That Attack-Dog Strategy Has Its Limits
item.media:description: Senator Chuck Schumer warned President-elect Donald J. Trump recently that it was “really dumb” to take on the intelligence services and that he should “calm down” his Twitter usage.
item.description: The report on Russian efforts to influence the outcome of the election made it clear that a tactic from the campaign would not necessarily work in Washington.
item.dc:creator: GLENN THRUSH

item.title: News Analysis: Russian Intervention in American Election Was No One-Off
item.media:description: Vladimir V. Putin holds a grudge against Hillary Clinton, and the Russian intervention to damage her candidacy was the latest fusillade in a yearslong campaign.
item.description: The hacking, detailed in a report by three intelligence agencies was only one element in an information war that has gone on under the radar for years.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE

item.title: What Intelligence Agencies Concluded About the Russian Attack on the U.S. Election
item.description: In unequivocal language, the unclassified version of the report for President Obama pins responsibility directly on President Vladimir V. Putin.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE

item.title: Florida Airport Assailant May Have Heard Voices Urging Violence, Officials Say
item.media:description: Esteban Santiago, 26, made disturbing remarks at the F.B.I. office in Anchorage in November, according to a senior law enforcement official.
item.description: Federal law enforcement officials identified the suspect in a shooting that left at least five dead as a 26-year-old former National Guardsmen.
item.dc:creator: LIZETTE ALVAREZ, RICHARD FAUSSET and ADAM GOLDMAN

item.title: Scenes From Fort Lauderdale Airport Shooting
item.description: Witnesses filmed the chaos after a gunman shot and killed several people inside the Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on Friday.

item.title: Recovery Finally Yields Big Gains for Average Worker’s Pay
item.media:description: A job fair in Brighton, Colo., on Dec. 14. For all his criticism of President Obama’s economic stewardship during the campaign, Donald J. Trump inherits an economy that is fundamentally solid.
item.description: Average hourly earnings rose by 2.9 percent last year, the best performance since the recession, even as job growth tapered off in December.
item.dc:creator: NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

item.title: Economic Legacy: How Obama’s Jobs Record Stacks Up
item.media:description: President Obama in February 2009 after a brutal jobs report, the first issued during his administration.
item.description: Comparing his performance with that of other presidents: Things could have been much worse, and at the start, they were.
item.dc:creator: NEIL IRWIN

item.title: Take the Polar Plunge in Milwaukee
item.description: Every year on Jan. 1 in Milwaukee, hundreds of brave souls swim in the freezing waters of Lake Michigan.

item.title: Your Daily Mini Crossword
item.description: Solve a bite-size crossword in just a few minutes.

item.title: Jared Kushner, a Trump In-Law and Adviser, Chases a Chinese Deal
item.media:description: Donald J. Trump officially announced his campaign for the presidency at Trump Tower in Manhattan on June 16, 2015, with his daughter Ivanka and her husband, Jared Kushner, at his side.
item.description: As Donald J. Trump’s son-in-law prepares for a White House role, his undisclosed talks with a secretive Chinese company highlight potential conflicts of interest.
item.dc:creator: SUSANNE CRAIG, JO BECKER and JESSE DRUCKER

item.title: Trump Insists Mexico Will Pay for Wall After U.S. Begins the Work
item.media:description: A newly built section of the United States-Mexico border wall, photographed in November. President-elect Donald J. Trump claimed on Friday that Mexico would reimburse the United States once construction began on a new barrier.
item.description: President-elect Donald J. Trump made the comments after Republicans in Congress started discussing ways to include money for the barrier in spending bills.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

item.title: Trump Nominees’ Filings Threaten to Overwhelm Federal Ethics Office
item.media:description: Rex W. Tillerson, right, with Senator Benjamin L. Cardin of Maryland. Mr. Tillerson filed an “ethics undertakings” memo with the State Department this week.
item.description: Rex W. Tillerson’s financial disclosure, showing the stocks and other assets he has to sell off to avoid conflicts, is among a wave of filings for what may be the wealthiest cabinet in modern history.
item.dc:creator: ERIC LIPTON and STEVE EDER

item.title: The Playlist: Ed Sheeran Returns With a Foot in the Past and an Eye on the Future
item.description: The new songs that caught our pop critics' attention this week, from Elliott Smith's rediscovered track to the Flaming Lips' latest collaboration with Miley Cyrus.
item.dc:creator: JON PARELES, JON CARAMANICA and NATE CHINEN

item.title: Beating of Disabled Teenager Highlights a Crime That Often Goes Unpunished
item.description: After four in Chicago were charged with hate crimes for an assault caught on a Facebook video, advocates for those with disabilities still hold that violence against the group is often underreported.
item.dc:creator: MITCH SMITH and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

item.title: Hate Crime Charges Brought in Chicago Torture Case
item.description: The incident set off new discussions about racial tensions and the role of social media.

item.title: N.F.L. Wild-Card Matchups: Who We Think Will Win
item.media:description: Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford has a 1-3 record as a starter since dislocating his right middle finger.
item.media:credit: Raj Mehta/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
item.description: Sunday’s playoff games will recall past triumphs in frigid conditions by the visitors, while Saturday’s contests will be missing key players, who are out with injuries.
item.dc:creator: DAVID WHITE

item.title: Raiders vs. Texans: Battle of the Bad Quarterbacks
item.media:description: Raiders quarterback Connor Cook fumbled in the team’s regular-season finale last Sunday against the Broncos. He replaced Matt McGloin, and was 14 of 21 passing for 150 yards.
item.description: Brock Osweiler, with 21 career starts, is a wily veteran compared with the Raiders’ Connor Cook, who will make his first N.F.L. start.
item.dc:creator: BENJAMIN HOFFMAN

item.title: ‘He Really Is Beholden to No One — Not Even His Own Party’
item.description: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate Donald Trump’s tweets on security and ethics, what the Democrats want, and the top travel destinations of 2017.
item.dc:creator: LELA MOORE and SONA PATEL

item.title: Table for Three: Samantha Bee and Jane Pauley Are Breaking the News
item.media:description: Jane Pauley, left, and Samantha Bee sitting for lunch at Asiate restaurant in the Mandarin Oriental hotel in New York.
item.media:credit: George Etheredge for The New York Times
item.description: The late-night news comedian and the veteran television journalist compare notes on the news — real, fake and satirical.
item.dc:creator: PHILIP GALANES
item.category: Full Frontal With Samantha Bee (TV Program)

item.title: Owners Think Their Dogs Are So Smart. Scientists Are Smarter.
item.media:description: Giorgio, 11, with his certificates and achievements at the Yale Canine Cognition Center.
item.media:credit: Joshua Bright for The New York Times
item.description: University researchers are tapping a growing interest in pets’ intelligence, even if they have their own ideas about how to define and measure it.
item.dc:creator: JAN HOFFMAN

item.title: In Zimbabwe, a First Lady Exerts Her Power
item.media:description: Grace Mugabe at the opening of the Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front’s annual congress last month in Masvingo, Zimbabwe.
item.description: Grace Mugabe, the wife of President Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe, is one of the main actors maneuvering to succeed him.
item.dc:creator: NORIMITSU ONISHI

item.title: California Today
item.description: The news and stories that matter to Californians (and anyone else interested in the state). Sign up to get it by email.

item.title: On Soccer: After Premier League Title, Leicester City Learns Magic Goes Only So Far
item.media:description: Masks of Jamie Vardy of Leicester City after the club’s match against Everton on Dec. 26.
item.description: Giddy disbelief settled among fans and around the team during the run to the Premier League championship last season. But months after the fact, the glow is fading.
item.dc:creator: RORY SMITH

item.title: In Turkey’s Unrest, Some See an Extreme Version of Post-9/11 America
item.media:description: Police officers in Istanbul, near a nightclub where New Year’s revelers were killed. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has responded to violence and a coup attempt with a furious crackdown.
item.description: Turkey’s president and his allies say no other democracy has withstood such relentless terrorist attacks and a coup attempt.
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO and RICK GLADSTONE
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

item.title: Kerry Lists Obama Era’s Diplomatic Successes. (Trump Opposes Them All.)
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry wrote an exit memo enumerating the Obama administration’s foreign policy accomplishments.
item.description: In a memo summing up the last eight years of foreign policy, the secretary of state enumerated and defended the Obama administration’s work.
item.dc:creator: RUSSELL GOLDMAN

item.title: Trilobites: Light Pillars, a Million-Mirror Optical Illusion on Winter Nights
item.media:description: Light pillars in Sun Valley, Idaho.
item.description: It might look like a mother ship hovering above the planet, waiting to carry you away. It’s really an interplay of icy clouds and light pollution.
item.dc:creator: JOANNA KLEIN

item.title: Tilikum, the Killer Whale Featured in ‘Blackfish,’ Dies
item.media:description: Tilikum at SeaWorld Orlando in 2010, the year his trainer, Dawn Brancheau, was killed.
item.description: SeaWorld announced that orca, thought to have been around 36 years old, died after suffering health problems, including a lung infection.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE HAUSER

item.title: Winter Storm Threatens Atlanta and Rest of Southeast
item.media:description: Customers looked for eggs on depleted store shelves of a supermarket in Decatur, Ga., on Thursday, ahead of a winter storm expected to drop several inches of snow on southern states.
item.description: Snow, sleet and freezing rain were forecast in Kentucky, North Carolina, South Carolina and other states in the South.
item.dc:creator: ERIN McCANN

item.title: The Fix: A High-End Kitchen on the Cheap
item.media:description: Collin and Ashley Bond in their kitchen in Scarsdale, N.Y., with appliances scored at bargain prices.
item.media:credit: Linda Jaquez for The New York Times
item.description: Sites like Craigslist may be the best way to score expensive appliances at rock-bottom prices. All you need is a little patience.
item.dc:creator: MICHELLE HIGGINS

item.title: Giants Coach Becomes a Zinger Magnet on His Way to the Playoffs
item.media:description: Giants Coach Ben McAdoo with the play-call sheet that some fans can’t get enough of.
item.description: Ben McAdoo has been praised, teased, impersonated by a 12-year-old boy and tagged with nicknames like McAdozy and McAdaring — all in his first year as head coach.
item.dc:creator: BILL PENNINGTON

item.title: Appointment: This Men’s Wear Shop Is Not for Everyone
item.media:description: Vivek Nagrani in his store in the Bowery, VK Nagrani.
item.media:credit: Andrew White for The New York Times
item.description: The designer Vivek Nagrani has a close relationship with his clients — and Bruce Wayne.
item.dc:creator: VALERIYA SAFRONOVA

item.title: The Neediest Cases: A Young Mother’s Solitary, Uphill Struggle
item.media:description: Myasia Williams with her son, Tyrell Jr., 4. She says she tells him, “Daddy’s away and he loves you. He misses you very much.”
item.media:credit: Emon Hassan for The New York Times
item.description: Myasia Williams, whose husband is in jail, struggles with motherhood, a job, school, bills, an overcrowded apartment and her husband’s absence.
item.dc:creator: JOHN OTIS
item.category: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
